author: paulhauner
content:
What's the current status-quo on setting `safeBlockHash`? LH has it set to the head block, as per some old specifications.

My understanding is that the "safe head" was something that the research team *thought* they had figured out but then it turned to be more complex than originally considered.

My feeling is that if we're communicating something to be "safe" and we don't have a definition of what "safe" means, then we should use the finalized checkpoint. cc <@425572898787426305>

author: terencechain
content: the latest spec specifies to use justified checkpoint: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/2858

author: paulhauner
content: Oh thanks, I didn't even realise this `safe_block` spec existed!

author: ajsutton
content: First rule of Ethereum - there's always another spec, in another repo, mentioned on a different chat room. ðŸ™‚

author: m.kalinin
content: Actually, this safe block spec is linked from the Bellatrix fork choice spec. Though, I admit that this link is kinda lost among other statements

author: m.kalinin
content: The status quo is to use justified as a safe block as its quite safe from re-orgs and is used as initial checkpoint for the safe algorithm that we have. Once the algorithm is improved we will upgrade `get_safe_beacon_block_root` function to return a block that is closer to the head
